Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with added white bands; exterior reserved wth graffito inscription.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. However, given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of a chalice of another style.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 741, no. 1002)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 100, no. 304.2, pl. XXXII, no. 304.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1189) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5906 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
